intro: Dracaena dawei, commonly known as the Chinese evergreen, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and long, narrow leaves that are typically variegated with yellow or white markings. The plant produces small, inconspicuous greenish-white flowers that appear at the base of the leaves. Dracaena dawei is well adapted to indoor environments and thrives in bright, indirect light with moderate humidity. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and air-purifying properties.
